0.Pros: The pay is good, everyone is nice to work with, most of the customers are nice, and it’s a good work environment.
0.Cons: The hours are all mixed up, sometimes we’re short staff and you have to stay longer cause of that.

1.Pros: Very fast paced working environment that will help you out in the long run with top notch companies that have no room for mistakes.
1.Cons: Unfortunately managers seem not to care as much if you have multiple customers and leave you by yourself to take care of everything.

2.Pros: meeting people, respecting the customers and co workers, paid vacations, room for growth, even pay for your college.
2.Cons: unhappy customers, employees that don't take customers are the reason we are here.

3.Pros: The people I. Worked with were great
3.Cons: How you smell when you get off

4.Summary: "Amazing experience for anyone looking to do ANYTHING"
4.Pros: I knew from the time I was in first grade I wanted to be a teacher. The lessons that I learned from working at McDonalds helps me in my teaching career! Flexible schedule
4.Cons: You smell when you are finished working.

5.Summary: "It was rough. They do not have enough employees for the overnight shift, that manager desperately deserves more help."
5.Pros: The people I worked with couldn't have been any better of a team. As long as everyone is willing and works together it all works out.
5.Cons: The certain hours we call "rushes". For example lunch time is very hectic and the breakfast hours are also unimaginable.

6.Cons: Rules arenot applied faidly to crew and management.

7.Pros: It is not that bad it is just how the managers are.
7.Cons: managers are always taking things out on their workers

8.Pros: Nice People, Free Food, Easy to tailor your schedule, Easy to get days off,
8.Cons: Management, Free Food, Some employees don't do their job, lack of organization

9.Pros: Works with part time schedules.Free meal for working a shift.Job is easy to do with proper training.
